timeline.bodyText: else should be on a new line.
timeline.author: NSAmelchev

timeline.bodyText:
Suppose that next processes in the cluster will happen simultaneously:

The END_SNAPSHOT DP will be at the finish stage and only part of nodes processed their 'this::processLocalSnapshotEndStageResult'
Part of nodes executes broadcasted closure cancelLocalSnapshotTask

They are processed by different threads. Can we get a situation when part of nodes finish clusterSnpFut successfully and other ones with error? It's ok?
timeline.author: NSAmelchev

replies.bodyText:
Nikita,

It's true that some operations may execute concurrently on snapshot cancellation operation.
Snapshot operation consists of four stages:


start-stage
start-stage result
end-stage
end-stage result

If cancel operation occurred when on start-stage than snapshot operation will be canceled. On other stages, it will have no effect since all the cache data already collected.

clusterSnpFut is set on coordinator only, so it has no effect in case described by you. If some of the local snapshot tasks finish with an error an the other with CancelledException than all results will be finished with CancelledException (all intermediate results will be deleted).
replies.author: Mmuzaf

timeline.author: NSAmelchev
NSAmelchev

IGNITE-12978: scan query cancel test flaky
